channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#1671; 10:25PM; 8764 S HOBART BL; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/HRhbQufVucpJMcfP9" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/HRhbQufVucpJMcfP9</a>; #GramercyPark; Companies arrived to find a vacant one-story single family dwelling well-involved with fire. Following extended forcible entry challenges, 36 firefighters focused on protecting neighboring homes and extinguishing the fire using coordinated interior and roof operations. Total working time to knockdown was 19 minutes, though crews remain on-scene for overhaul. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; E(3) T(2) RA(2) RA-800(1) E57 RA857 RA257 E266 T66 E33 E64 T64 E264 BC13 BC11 RA57 EM13 ; CH7; 12; Lyndsey Lantz

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0854; 03:13PM; 5517 W San Vicente Blvd; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/upEamVv3Cc2vLLqXA" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/upEamVv3Cc2vLLqXA</a>; #MidWilshire; 78 firefighters battled fire in this vacant strip mall for 1 hour and 49 minutes. Crews initially forced entry to the structure and mounted an interior attack with handlines, in coordination with companies on the roof who ventilated the structure. Once "defensive mode" was declared, all personnel retreated from the structure and fought fire with heavy streams of water from a distance. One front facade and the roof collapsed, with no injuries reported. Though a second facade appeared compromised, a complete knockdown of the fire was declared with no further structural collapse. All nearby exposures were protected with no fire spread. Several support companies were attached to the incident to provide rehabilitation and air tanks to firefighters on-scene. LAFD's heavy equipment specialists and several fire companies remain on-scene for a planned demolition of the vacant building due to safety concerns. The cause of the fire remains under investigation.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; E(6) T(6) RA(2) RA-800(2) E68 E261 T61 RA861 RA61 E58 E229 T29 E294 T94 BC18 BC11 SO1 E215 T15 E13 CM22 EM5 BC13 CM20 E61 RA58 T27 E227 UR27 E95 SQ95 EM11 T3 E203 E3 UR3 HR3 UR88 BC1 RA803 PI1 PI2 HE1 RS3 EA1 AR1 AR7 AR39 ; CH9; 15; Lyndsey Lantz

Structure Fire; INC#0854; 01:24PM; 5517 W San Vicente Blvd; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/upEamVv3Cc2vLLqXA" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/upEamVv3Cc2vLLqXA</a>; #MidWilshire; Initial arriving companies found a one-story vacant and boarded-up strip mall, approximately 50ft x 75ft, with light smoke showing from the attic. Crews initiated forcible entry and roof operations, but the fire load and extended operation time ultimately forced personnel to adopt a "defensive" posture -- all companies retreated and heavy streams of water were employed to continue extinguishing the flames and protect all exposures. One facade collapsed due to fire load during use of heavy water streams; no injuries reported. Crews remain active on-scene at this time.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; E(6) T(6) RA(2) RA-800(2) E68 E261 T61 RA861 RA61 E58 E229 T29 E294 T94 BC18 BC11 SO1 E215 T15 E13 CM22 EM5 BC13 CM20 E61 RA58 T27 E227 UR27 E95 SQ95 EM11 T3 E203 E3 UR3 HR3 UR88 BC1 RA803 PI1 PI2 HE1 RS3 EA1 AR1 AR7 AR39 ; CH9; 15; Lyndsey Lantz

Hiker Rescue; INC#0696; 11:50AM; 4730 Crystal Springs Dr; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3yNc3e0" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3yNc3e0</a>; #GriffithPark; Park rangers on-scene in a remote area of Griffith Park reported an injured male hiker, approximately 23 years old, with an ankle injury. LAFD's helicopter crew lowered a paramedic down to the patient, while ground crews made access to the remote location with vehicles capable of navigating Griffith Park's narrow trails. Due to steep and difficult terrain, LAFD personnel ultimately decided to hoist the patient into a helicopter and transport him to a nearby hospital for further treatment.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E235 E56 H4 H5 HA4 HA5 RA35 RA56 RA835 RH114 T35; CH7; 14; Lyndsey Lantz

Update KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0408; 09:13AM; 6400 S Crenshaw Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/450K070" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/450K070</a>; #HydePark; 37 firefighters spent 17 minutes in the offensive mode, fully extinguishing a well-involved fire. No injuries were reported, and no occupants were located in the home during searches. Companies remain on-scene for overhaul and salvage of property; traffic will be temporarily affected in the immediate area.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 BC18 E294 E57 E66 E94 RA266 RA66 RA866 SO1 SQ21 T66 T94; CH9; 13; Lyndsey Lantz

Structure Fire; INC#0408; 08:56AM; 6400 S Crenshaw Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/450K070" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/450K070</a>; #HydePark; Firefighters onscene report a one-story single family dwelling, with fire showing from the rear of the home and from the attic. First arriving companies will be in the offensive mode, entering the structure and proceeding to the roof to attack the fire.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 BC18 E294 E57 E66 E94 RA66 RA866 SQ21 T66 T94; CH9; 13; Lyndsey Lantz

Technical Rescue; INC#1682; 08:58PM; 7001 S Central Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3V8wKZI" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3V8wKZI</a>; Florence; LAFD arrived to find an unknown age male postal employee with his leg trapped between 2 conveyor belts. Firefighters, including Urban Search and Rescue (USAR), have successfully freed the patient from entrapment and will transport to an area hospital in unknown condition. Nothing further.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC13 E203 E205 E233 E3 E33 EM13 HR3 RA21 RA5 T3 T33 T5 UR3 UR5 UR88; CH7; 13; Jennifer Middleton

Traffic; INC#1556; 07:29PM; 491 E 42nd Pl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3V2rfvf" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3V2rfvf</a>; Historic South-Central; LAFD on scene of a 4 vehicle traffic collision with no entrapment. Seven patients are being assessed for injuries, with two persons being transported to area hospitals. #LATraffic: Expects delays due street closures until LAFD and LAPD operations are complete. No further details. LAPD Inc# 4120.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 E14 E21 E221 E46 EM1 HR3 RA14 RA21 SQ21 T21; CH7; 13; Jennifer Middleton

Physical Rescue; INC#1301; 04:37PM; 1354 W 46th St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/451nSt8" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/451nSt8</a>; Vermont Square; LAFD arrived to find 1 car collided into a building trapping a person between the vehicle and the structure. Sadly, the trapped patient was determined deceased on scene by firefighters. The condition of the vehicle's driver is unknown at this time. Los Angeles City Building and Safety were notified and are responding to assess the extent of damage to the building. LAPD Inc# 3399. ; FS 46; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E15 E215 E266 E46 E66 EM11 HR3 RA266 RA46 RA66 RA846 T15 T66; CH7; 13; Jennifer Middleton

Update KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1049; 02:11PM; 7708 N Eton Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3Kra9lP" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3Kra9lP</a>; Canoga Park; Firefighters arrived to find an outside rubbish fire exposing and extending into a single family home. A portion of the first 32 LAFD firefighters engaged in extinguishing the exterior fire, while the remainder of the crew made entry into the occupancy. While inside the structure, a small amount of smoke and fire was located adjacent to the exterior burn and was successfully extinguished in 17 minutes. No injuries to civilians or fire department members. Cause under investigation. Nothing further; FS 72; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E105 E106 E296 E305 E72 RA104 RA72 RA872 T105 T96; CH9; 17; Jennifer Middleton
